thread.title: It’s 1, 2, 3 strikes for Betts at the old bowl game
thread.title_full: It’s 1, 2, 3 strikes for Betts at the old bowl game

author: Red Burnham For the Journal Inquirer
title: It’s 1, 2, 3 strikes for Betts at the old bowl game
text:
Larger font size Posted: Saturday, October 10, 2015 12:05 am It’s 1, 2, 3 strikes for Betts at the old bowl game By Red Burnham For the Journal Inquirer Journal Inquirer | 0 comments 
It’s not unusual to find a star baseball player who also has high-level athletic skills in other sports, such as bowling and golf. This is the case with Mookie Betts, the outstanding young center fielder for the Boston Red Sox. 
Mookie was one of the bright spots for the Red Sox this season, batting .291 with 18 home runs, 77 RBIs, 92 runs scored, and 21 stolen bases. He also is one of four players in baseball history to finish with 40-plus doubles, 15-plus homers and over 20 steals before turning 23. 
Now the kid from Tennessee would like take a crack at bowling, a sport he did a lot of while in high school. Mookie carried a plus-200 average while bowling for Nashville Overton High School and finished third in the Tennessee Secondary Schools Athletic Association state championships. He has a pair of sanctioned 300 games to his credit, an 827 series, and was named the Tennessee Boys’ Bowler of the Year in 2010. kAmq6EED D2:5 96 H@F=5 =@G6 E2<6 A2CE :? r9C:D !2F=’D 2??F2= r!b !qp r6=63C:EJ x?G:E2E:@?2=] %9:D =65 E96 !qp E@ 6IE6?5 2? :?G:E2E:@?
